raw release dates.notes: (segment "The Tale of the Radish Robber") (Kinder Film Festival)

release dates: Japan::7 August 2013                            (segment "The Tale of the Radish Robber") (Kinder Film Festival)

1.title: The Puddleduck Disaster/The Squirrel Hotpot
1.plot: Peter tells a curious Cotton-tail how he and Squirrel Nutkin became friends and how the squirrel lost his tail. Soon Peter is on an adventure to retrieve Nutkin's tail, even though it means going to Owl Island.

2.title: The Tunnel Rumbler/The Frightened Fox
2.plot: When Peter and his co. mistake the scary "ribbit" echoes of the lost Jeremy Fisher for a scary monster through a series of misunderstandings, they set about to rid their tunnels of this mysterious intruder. / When Mr. Tod steals the rabbits' blackberries and tin can after a casual ambush and Peter vows to retrieve them, he soon finds himself in much deeper danger than he could have realized.

3.title: The Great Owl Adventure
3.plot: When Peter uses a model to scare off Old Brown, he ends up scaring the squirrels away too! Peter must not only persuade the squirrels to return to their camp but also get Old Brown to leave his new roost - right over Benjamin's burrow!

4.title: The Best Bowler/The Great Potato Plunder
4.plot: When Peter and Nutkin's pine cone bowling rivalry gets out of hand, it leads to big trouble... When Peter hears about his father's greatest ever heist, he embarks on some high risk highway robbery - Mr. McGregor's entire wheelbarrow of potatoes on its way to market!

5.title: Cotton-tail's Treetop Tumble/Perilous Party
5.plot: After Old Brown snatches her, Cotton-tail gets stuck up a tree. It's up to Peter, Lily, and Benjamin to rescue her before either a passing Mr Tod seizes her or the angry Owl returns. When Peter discovers Mr Tod is the host of a surprise party, he must save the guests from becoming party food.

6.title: High-Flying Badger/Benjamin's Blunder
6.plot: When a very sleepy Tommy Brock is hoisted up into the Squirrel Camp, Peter and friends must work out how to get the snoozing brute back down to earth before he wakes up! When Peter realizes he has accidentally upset Benjamin by asking him to sit out the next garden raid, he goes to apologize only to find his cousin has gone.

7.title: The Tiny Terror/Treehouse Rescue
7.plot: Peter's plans to raid Mr McGregor's garden are thwarted when he discovers the Shrew has got there first. It's down to the rabbits to find a way to get their garden back. When Peter is forced to reveal the location of the secret treehouse to Flopsy and Mopsy, the girls decide to hang out in Peter's den -- just as Old Brown launches a tree-top attack!

8.title: The Lost Journal/The Need for Seed
8.plot: When Benjamin accidentally loses Peter's dad's journal, it falls into the clutches of Mr Tod... When Mr McGregor fills a bird table with sunflower seeds, Squirrel Nutkin becomes dangerously obsessed with raiding it...

9.title: Heroic Hedgehog/The Bird Trap
9.plot: When Peter escapes a very chatty Mrs Tiggy-winkle to go strawberry-raiding, he is surprised to be helped out of trouble by none other than the feisty old hedgehog herself! When Mr Tod's efforts to creep up on the rabbits are thwarted by anoisy Song Thrush, he cages the bird so that he can ambush Peter and his friends without warning...

10.title: Dr. Bobtail's Adventure/Locked Cage
10.plot: When Squirrel Nutkin feels too poorly to move, the rabbits must sneak Dr Bobtail onto Owl Island... When Mr McGregor locks him in a cage with Sammy Whiskers, Peter must join forces with the rat to escape.

11.title: Missing Ducklings/Hungry Thieves
11.plot: A simple matter of duckling-sitting turns into a potential disaster when the ducklings escape into the wood. When Sammy Whiskers dupes three innocent mice into stealing the rabbits' plum pie, Peter must rescue both pie and mice from the clutches of Mr Tod.

12.title: Nutkin's Rabbity Day/Unexpected Hero
12.plot: Peter, Lily and Benjamin's daily routine takes an unexpected turn when Nutkin insists on joining them to 'become a rabbit' after mistakenly assuming that his fellow squirrel tribe has seemingly forgotten his birthday. But for him, being a 'fake rabbit' leads to real trouble with Mr. Tod, who is casually up to his old tricks. / After escaping the clutches of Mr. Tod, Jeremy Fisher accompanies the rabbits for a casual garden raid, and Peter finds that this is astonishingly rewarding when he learns that Mr. McGregor is fond of frogs.

13.title: Amazing Mom/Mom's Precious Things
13.plot: When Mr Tod and Sammy Whiskers team up to strike the rabbits' big picnic, Peter must team up with the only rabbit who can match him for speed and cunning - his mom. When Peter accidentally discards his mother's most precious possessions he must retrieve them from Tommy Brock!

14.title: The Racing Rabbit/Fred Snail
14.plot: When the rabbits volunteer to deliver Mrs Tiggy-winkle's laundry using their newly built, super fast go-kart, a routine delivery turns into a high speed adventure! Benjamin gets a pet snail, but his friends can't see the appeal - especially when it attracts the attention of Old Brown!

15.title: The Saving of the Shrew/Fish Out of Water
15.plot: When Mr Tod tramples on the Shrew's precious dandelions, the angry Shrew vows revenge... but when Cotton-tail follows him into Mr Tod's lair, Peter, Lily, and Benjamin must go on a dangerous mission to rescue them both! When Old Brown catches their friend Jack Sharp, Peter, Lily, and Benjamin must race to return this "fish out of water" to the lake!

16.title: The Kitten and Pig Adventure
16.plot: Peter meets some surprising new friends at Hill Top Farm, but when a big storm hits the woods, everyone is in grave danger...

17.title: Cotton-tail's Party/The Thing-A-Ma-Jig
17.plot: When Peter promises the Shrew some worms to entice him to Cotton-tail's birthday party, he ends up accidentally putting everyone in danger. When Mr Bouncer invents something that seemingly has no specific function, the rabbits endeavour to find out what it's for. But when Mr Tod comes after them, will the 'thing-a-ma-jig' be a help or a hindrance in their escape?

18.title: The Big Badger Blunder/Squabbling Squirrels
18.plot: When Tommy Brock decides to move in to the Farmyard, Mittens needs Peter Rabbit's help to evict him! When Felix and Nutkin quarrel, leaving the Squirrel Camp in chaos, it's down to Peter to help them make up before disaster strikes...

19.title: Peter's Great Escape/The Great Cake Chase
19.plot: When the rabbits find themselves surrounded, Peter is forced to create a brand new ingenious escape route. When Peter is charged with minding Ginger and Pickles' store, he finds running a shop is no easy feat, especially with customers like Sammy Whiskers!

20.title: Go-Kart Getaway/The New Hideout
20.plot: When Sammy Whiskers steals the rabbits' go-kart, with Cotton-tail on board, Peter needs to race faster than ever to rescue his sister! When the rabbits are forced out of their secret tree- house, they learn that finding a new hideout isn't the hard part... it's keeping it secret!

21.title: The Tale of the Tricky Tortoise/The Tale of the Mice on the Move
21.plot: Peter learns not to judge a book by its cover when he takes an elderly Tortoise for a 'quiet' walk in the woods.

22.title: The Tale of the Flooded Burrow/The Tale of Mittens's New Friend
22.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

23.title: The Tale of the Spilled Milk/The Tale of the First Bluebell
23.plot: When Peter, Lily and Benjamin accidentally spill Mittens' milk, they launch a daring mission to replace it.

24.title: The Tale of the Great Tortoise Rescue/The Tale of the King of the Woods
24.plot: When Peter accidentally sends a slumbering Mr Tolly floating off to Owl Island, he immediately launches a rescue with his friends.

25.title: The Christmas Star/Sleepy Hedgehog
25.plot: When Tommy Brock takes Cotton-tail's dolly, Peter soon discovers the only way to retrieve it is to give everyone in the woods what they want for Christmas...

26.title: The Tale of Musical Mayhem/The Tale of the Journal's End
26.plot: Auditions are held for an annual recital, but Mr. Tod may ruin things. / Peter risks losing his journal to save Flopsy and Mopsy.

27.title: The Tale of the Spectacular Sledge/The Tale of Cotton-Tail's Tooth
27.plot: When the rabbits discover a hoard of much needed winter vegetables in Mr McGregor's garden, they must find a way to transport them - by building a spectacular new sled!

29.title: The Unexpected Discovery
29.plot: The rabbit's plans for a casual garden raid takes an unexpected turn when Peter discovers Mr. McGregor's newest invention: a silent black-and-white camera. After Benjamin is accidentally taken inside Mr. McGregor's farmhouse oblivious to him, Peter and Lily bravely venture inside to rescue him with some help from Nutkin, which also leads Peter to a pleasant surprise: retrieving a roll of film tape and seeing old silent black-and-white film footage of his late father.

0.title: Peter Rabbit's Christmas Tale
0.plot: When Mr. Bouncer gets too sick to make the important holiday supply delivery, Peter and Benjamin take it upon themselves to brave a blizzard (and Mr. Tod) to get the job done and meet a new friend along the way.

1.title: The Tale of the Radish Robber/The Tale of Two Enemies
1.plot: Peter and his friends try to find the perfect place to eat the radishes they took from Mr. McGregor's garden, but little do they know they've got a radish robber on their tails! When Peter decides to set Mr. Tod and Tommy Brock against each other, he soon finds out that breaking the food chain is harder than it looks.

2.title: The Tale of Benjamin's Strawberry Raid/The Tale of the Lying Fox
2.plot: When Benjamin takes charge of a strawberry harvest raid on Mr. McGregor's garden, he learns that it's harder than he thought to be a good leader. When Mr. Tod is trapped in Mr. McGregor's garden, Peter reluctantly agrees to help him escape, but soon learns that you should never trust a fox!

3.title: The Tale of the Greedy Fox/The Tale of the Secret Treehouse
3.plot: When Peter tells an impulsive lie, which leads Jemima Puddle-Duck into Mr. Tod's clutches, he must act fast to stop her from becoming the fox's dinner! Peter proves he's got what it takes to be part of the squirrel tribe when he competes for his own treetop hideout.

4.title: The Tale of the Angry Cat/The Tale of Mr. Tod's Trap
4.plot: When Peter accidentally brings home Mr. McGregor's Cat rather than a cart of freshly picked Brussels sprouts, he's got to find a way to lure the angry cat back into the garden while staying one step ahead of her claws! When Peter, Benjamin and Lily are tempted by a mysterious hoard of radishes, Lily finds herself caught in Mr. Tod's trap. Can Peter find a way to rescue Lily before Mr. Tod reaches her?

5.title: The Tale of Nutkin on the Run/The Tale of the Wriggly Worms
5.plot: When Squirrel Nutkin angers Old Brown by taking his glasses, it's up to Peter and his friends to put things right. When Peter makes a rash promise to appease an angry Tommy Brock, he and his friends find themselves worming for their lives.

6.title: The Tale of Jemima's Egg/The Tale of the Great Breakout
6.plot: When Peter is asked to watch Jemima's egg, he discovers that babysitting is far more dangerous than he could ever have imagined. When Mr. McGregor captures the whole squirrel tribe in his garden, Peter must stage a mass break out to save his friends.

7.title: The Tale of the Lucky Four Leaf Clover/The Tale of the Unguarded Garden
7.plot: When Benjamin finds a four-leaf clover, Peter tricks him into thinking it brings good luck. It's harmless fun until Peter's prank accidentally leads Lily into Mr. Tod's dangerous clutches! When Mr. McGregor goes away for the day, Peter can't wait to raid the garden. But will the absence of one foe leave our hero and his little sister at the mercy of another?

8.title: The Tale of the Big Move/The Tale of the Lost Tunnels
8.plot: When Lily's father decides to move the family out of the Lake District, Peter comes up with a clever, but dangerous, plan to change Dr. Bobtail's mind.When Benjamin gets lost in a network of underground tunnels, Peter and Lily set out to find him.

9.title: The Tale of the Start of Spring
9.plot: On the first day of spring, Peter's hopes of a wonderful spring party are shattered when a mystery thief (who is a devious newcomer rat named Sammy Whiskers) secretly steals Jemima's newly laid egg and tampers with the evidence, framing Peter. As Peter fights for his innocence, things become even worse when Mr. Tod enters the equation, also going after the egg. Now, Peter must not only retrieve the egg before it hatches, but also prove his innocence and the guilt of Samuel Whiskers.

10.title: The Tale of the Dash in the Dark/The Tale of the Grumpy Owl
10.plot: When Peter and his friends go into the woods at night to catch a jar full of glowworms for Cotton-tail's night light, they discover Cotton-tail isn't the only rabbit afraid of the dark. When Old Brown takes Peter's Journal, Peter must choose between saving his most precious possession and saving a friend.

11.title: The Tale of the Down Hill Escape/The Tale of the Cat and the Rat
11.plot: Peter takes Benjamin and Lily on a wild ride down a steep slope. But when Benjamin gets injured, Peter has to navigate them to safety past the clutches of Old Brown and Tommy Brock.

12.title: The Tale of the Mother's Day Pie/The Tale of the Mystery Plum Thief
12.plot: When Peter forgets to get his mother a present for Mother's Day, his hurried attempts to put things right leads to adventure. When Peter tries to get the last plum from Mr. McGregor's tree, he finds that a mysterious thief has beaten him to it!

13.title: The Tale of the Hazelnut Raid/The Tale of the Broken Bed
13.plot: When Peter accidentally destroys the Squirrels' store of nuts with one of Mr. Bouncer's misfiring inventions, Peter sets off to perilous Owl Island to replace them!

14.title: The Tale of the Hero Rabbit/The Tale of the Falling Rock
14.plot: When a band of desperate mice mistake Benjamin for a hero and enlist him to retrieve their stolen peas, Benjamin gets more than he bargained for.

1.title: The Tale of the One Who Got Away/The Tale of Cotton-tail's New Friend
1.plot: When Peter and friends encounter the legendary "Jack Sharp", a large trout that even Peter's father failed to catch, they try to reel the fish in once and for all. But catching a fish is a lot harder than it looks and besides, what do you do with a big, bad trout once you've caught it? When Cotton-tail leaves the burrow in search of her new playmate, the Shrew, Peter must scour the woods and find his sister before a hungry Old Brown does.

2.title: The Tale of the Runaway Kites/The Tale of the Surprising Sisters
2.plot: Benjamin's up in the air as the unwilling passenger of a flyaway kite! Can Peter and Lily put aside their differences and work together to rescue their friend?When Flopsy and Mopsy insist on accompanying Peter on one of his adventures, he discovers that there may be more to his twin sisters than he thought.

3.title: The Tale of the Giant Pumpkin/The Tale of the Fierce Bad Rabbit
3.plot: When Peter sets his sights on the biggest pumpkin in Mr. McGregor's patch, rolling it out of the garden turns into the ride of a lifetime. Peter and his friends set out to taste the sweetest dandelions in the world, only to find that they're protected by the meanest character in the entire valley!

4.title: The Tale of Cotton-tail's Cake/The Tale of the Terrible Trap
4.plot: When Cotton-tail's birthday cake is stolen and Peter vows to get it back, he finds himself in hot water with a host of angry villains! Tired of being constantly humiliated, the predators devise a plan that will get rid of that pesky Peter Rabbit once and for all... if they can work together long enough to pull it off!

5.title: The Tale of the Flying Fox/The Tale of Old Brown's Feather
5.plot: Peter finds a mysterious key hidden in his father's journal and is determined to find out what it fits. But his insatiable curiosity leads him into Mr. Tod's lair and a trap! When Peter takes one of Old Brown's tail-feathers, a wild chase across the valley ensues to retrieve the feather and pacify the furious owl!

6.title: The Tale of the Great Rabbit and Squirrel Adventure
6.plot: Peter tells a curious Cotton-tail how he and Squirrel Nutkin became friends and how the squirrel lost his tail. Soon Peter is on an adventure to retrieve Nutkin's tail, even though it means going to Owl Island!

7.title: The Tale of the Peek-a-Boo Rabbit/The Tale of Jeremy Fisher's Musical Adventure
7.plot: When Benjamin and Cotton-tail become lost in the Shadowy Woods during a game of peek-a-boo, can Peter use this very same game to help them elude a prowling Mr. Tod? When Jeremy Fisher gets into trouble while composing a new piece, only Peter and his friends can save him!

8.title: The Tale of Benjamin's New Map/The Tale of the Wrecked Treehouse
8.plot: After Benjamin gets lost in the woods, Peter and Lily give him a map to help him find his way home. But when the map falls into Mr. Tod's hands, the rabbits must work together to stop the fox from finding their home. When a big storm wrecks the rabbits' tree house, piecing it back together leads to big adventure.

9.title: The Tale of the Lost Ladybug/The Tale of Old Rusty
9.plot: When Peter accidentally loses Lily's ladybug, Florence, the rabbits embark on a dangerous chase to recover her precious pet. Peter and friends venture to Rocky Island to find the mysterious "Old Rusty" mentioned in Peter's father's journal.

10.title: The Tale of the Squeaky Toy/The Tale of the Flying Rabbits
10.plot: When Peter loses Cotton-tail's beloved squeaky rabbit toy, he must run the gauntlet of his enemies to get it back! When Peter learns that his father once crash-landed a flying machine into Mr.. McGregor's garden, he vows to find it and fly it home!

11.title: The Tale of Jeremy Fisher's Recital/The Tale of True Friends
11.plot: When Sammy Whiskers and Mr. Tod crash Jeremy Fisher's annual lake-side get together, it's up to Peter to save the party. When Benjamin is especially impressed by Lily's cleverness, Peter mistakenly thinks they no longer need him in the gang. But when Lily and Benjamin get trapped in Mr. McGregor's Garden, Peter soon realizes his friends need him more than ever!

12.title: The Tale of the Stolen Firewood/The Tale of the Runaway Rabbits
12.plot: When Peter, Lily and Benjamin go out to collect firewood, they soon find that not one but three predators are after some too. Can the rabbits stage a series of daring raids to retrieve it? Peter is left to babysit Cotton-tail but can't resist an exciting event at the Squirrel camp. He brings his sleeping sister along but soon must rescue her when she wakes up and crawls away.

13.title: The Tale of the Uninvited Badger/The Tale of the Brewing Storm
13.plot: When Tommy Brock decides he's had enough of the cold, he takes shelter by the fire inside the Bouncer's Burrow. It's up to Peter and his friends to devise a way of getting the grumpy badger out and to make sure he doesn't come back! Peter, Lily and Benjamin race to rescue Cotton-tail's beloved blanket, escape Mr. Tod, and get back home before a brewing storm finally breaks.

imdb.plot outline: Join Peter and his two bosom buddies; Benjamin and Lily, on their whimsical adventures through timeless Lake District. Peter encounters real dangers, and he and his loyal friends and family must use their wits to outsmart incompetent villains whose barks are way worse than their bites. Peter is a 6-year-old rabbit who lives with his mother underneath a huge fir tree in a hidden burrow. He misses his late father and desperately wants to grow up to be just like him. Armed with his father's journal, which is basically a guide to everything one needs to become a truly wild rabbit, and aided and abetted by his two best friends, Benjamin and Lily, Peter sets off to make his own mark in life.
imdb.title: Peter Rabbit
plot: Join Peter and his two bosom buddies; Benjamin and Lily, on their whimsical adventures through timeless Lake District. Peter encounters real dangers, and he and his loyal friends and family must use their wits to outsmart incompetent villains whose barks are way worse than their bites. Peter is a 6-year-old rabbit who lives with his mother underneath a huge fir tree in a hidden burrow. He misses his late father and desperately wants to grow up to be just like him. Armed with his father's journal, which is basically a guide to everything one needs to become a truly wild rabbit, and aided and abetted by his two best friends, Benjamin and Lily, Peter sets off to make his own mark in life.::Alfred J. Kolnik
